channel.title: No-IP problem!
channel.description:
Hi there again! Since no one asked my lastest topic about the other issue.. I will make it here.
I'm having the no-ip problem.. I can't connect to my ip but I can from 127.0.0.1
I've the port opened I think because I have the bitcomet opened and with the port 43594 opened and running..
Questions:
- Should I open the server first and then the bitcomet or the other way around?
- Can someone please try to connect to it just to see if it's okay or not? IM NOT ADVERTISING! Just to see if the problem is fixed or not!
saintscape.servegame.com
Post if you got in or not and what should I do.. Thanks![br][br][size=1]Posted on: 01 June 2009, 23:05:03[/size][hr]God damn it!
Someone help me out!!!
Sorry for the double post but I really need help!!

item.title: No-IP problem!
item.dc:creator: @soccerrules soccerrules
item.description:
@soccerrules wrote:

I tried with several account names. They all work through 127.0.0.1 but not through No-IP or my IP address.

Read full topic

item.title: No-IP problem!
item.dc:creator: @Bmaw Bmaw
item.description:
@Bmaw wrote:

[quote=“soccerrules, post:5, topic:281678”]Connection from jared.gateway.2wire.net:1555
Connection reset
java.net.SocketException: Connection reset
at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(Unknown Source)
at client.fillInStream(client.java:10172)
at client.run(client.java:18996)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
null has logged out.

I’m having a similar problem. Whenever I connect from my IP address or my No-Ip domain it fails to connect giving me the above error. What can fix this? I am almost positive I portforwarded correctly. I’ve done it before and it works fine. I’ll double check though. But any othe
r suggestions?

Your account is nulled.

Just delete your account file and sign in again[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: No-IP problem!
item.dc:creator: @soccerrules soccerrules
item.description:
@soccerrules wrote:

Connection from jared.gateway.2wire.net:1555
Connection reset
java.net.SocketException: Connection reset
at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(Unknown Source)
at client.fillInStream(client.java:10172)
at client.run(client.java:18996)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
null has logged out.

I’m having a similar problem. Whenever I connect from my IP address or my No-Ip domain it fails to connect giving me the above error. What can fix this? I am almost positive I portforwarded correctly. I’ve done it before and it works fine. I’ll double check though. But any other suggestions?

Read full topic

item.title: No-IP problem!
item.dc:creator: @Pheega Pheega
item.description:
@Pheega wrote:

[quote=“bower007, post:3, topic:281678”]I have it fowarded…

But noone can connect…

I will do it the same way…

TRY TO CONNECT AGAIN PLEASE![/quote]
Make sure you have it forwarded properly, and instead of asking people to try to connect to your server, you can test it yourself using your external IP and trying to connect to your server through that.
If you cannot connect, then you probably don’t have the port forwarded properly.

Read full topic

item.title: No-IP problem!
item.dc:creator: @bower007 bower007
item.description:

item.title: No-IP problem!
item.dc:creator: @Bmaw Bmaw
item.description:
@Bmaw wrote:

Well 127.0.0.1 is a default ip so you can connect to it no matter what.

You have to portforward your ip

It is against the rules to post questions about portforwarding.

www.portforward.com

Read full topic
